info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 06 at 1:27PM MST until January 10 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 2 PM MST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches for valleys, 3 to 6 inches for Marias Pass. Northeast winds gusting as high as 35 mph expected along Highway 2. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 16 inches for valleys. Marias Pass and the higher terrain could see 2 to 3 feet of snow. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph over Marias Pass Tuesday causing blowing and drifting snow. An arctic front passage Wednesday will cause a rapid temperatures drop and gusty northeast winds. * WHERE...Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Marias Pass, Bad Rock Canyon, Essex, and Polebridge. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 2 PM MST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday night through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible Tuesday through Wednesday. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. Travel could be affected. Bitter cold temperatures and dangerous wind chills will follow the frontal passage on Wednesday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
